description: Phased redevelopment of 1 West Cross Way, West Cross House and 1-6 Windsor Close - (Phase 1) Use of 1 West Cross Way for a hybrid use (sui generis) to include car workshop with MOT testing facilities, storage and distribution, offices and ancillary showroom for the sale of motor vehicles. Replacement of existing cladding and the installation of glazing to the front elevation Erection of a car wash facility at the rear of the building and the provision of 4 car display spaces, customer car parking and associated works. (Phase 2) The demolition and redevelopment of West Cross House and 1-6 Windsor Close for a new flexible E(g)(iii)/B2/B8 unit with office floorspace, new vehicular access, service yard and basement car parking; undercroft pedestrian and cycle entrance from the Great West Road and cycle store; together with landscaping, boundary and other associated works. Works to the estate roads, the Shield Drive junction to the Great West Road.

Condition : 4 - Construction Logistics Plan
(A)	Prior to the commencement of Phase 1 of development, and notwithstanding the approved details, a Construction Logistics Plan shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority for that phase. 
(B)	Prior to the commencement of Phase 2 of development, a demolition logistics plan shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the local authority for that phase. Before the commencement of the construction of phase 2, a a Construction Logistics Plan shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority for that phase.
 The Plan shall accord with TfL guidance and shall include:
i.	a site plan (showing the areas set out below);

iii.	provision for the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors;

Condition : 5 - Drainage 
(A)	Notwithstanding the approved plans, prior to commencement of Phase 1 of development (excluding site investigations and demolition), a finalised drainage design and strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase.
(B)	Notwithstanding the approved plans, prior to commencement of Phase 2 of development excluding site investigations and demolition, a finalised drainage design and strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase.
This shall include:
- Drawings and supporting calculations, and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to reflect the submitted details; 
- Details of how the drainage for the development accords to the drainage hierarchy and makes use of green infrastructure technology to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI3 and achieving a runoff rate which shall not exceed 12 litres/second. 
- A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. 
The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the buildings approved.
Condition : 6 - Evidence of drainage 
(A)	Phase 1 of the development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved for that phase has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
(B)	Phase 2 of the development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved for that phase has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Condition : 7 - Each Phase of the development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:
- At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
- At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
- No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
Condition : 8 - Landscaping
Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to the occupation of any Phase of the hereby approved development, details of hard and soft landscaping, including planting, hard and soft surfaces and boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and retained as such thereafter. Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation. 
Condition : 9 - Blue badge spaces
(A)	Prior to the commencement of Phase 1 (excluding demolition and site preparation works) and notwithstanding the submitted plans, full details of the blue badge parking bays for that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Parking on site must also be restricted to the marked bays only. 
(B)	Prior to the commencement of Phase 2 (excluding demolition and site preparation works) and notwithstanding the submitted plans, full details of the blue badge parking bays for that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Parking on site must also be restricted to the marked bays only. 
The bays shall be installed in accordance with the approved details and so maintained at all times thereafter. 
Condition : 10 - Cycle parking
(A)	Prior to occupation of Phase 1 and notwithstanding the submitted details, full details (including the number, location, design of structure and manufacturer's specifications) of all cycle stands for the occupants of, and visitors to, that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
(B)	Prior to occupation of Phase 2 and notwithstanding the submitted details, full details (including the number, location, design of structure and manufacturer's specifications) of all cycle stands for the occupants of, and visitors to, that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before any part of the development is first occupied and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
Condition : 11 - Energy Strategy
(A)	The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Statement received 13/01/2022 and Energy Addendum, received 09/03/2022. 

(B)	Upon final commencement of operation of any low- and zero-carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of five years from the point of full operation. 
Condition : 12 - BREEAM

(a)	Prior to the commencement of works on site, excluding demolition,  a BREEAM Non- Domestic Refurbishment and Fit Out 2014 Assessment part 1-4 for Phase 1, and BREEAM New Construction 2018 shell and core (not fully fitted) for phase 2 certificate and summary score sheet shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' rating has been achieved.

(b)	Within six months of first occupation of the building(s) BREEAM Non-Domestic Refurbishment and Fit Out 2014 Assessment part 1-4 for phase 1 and BREEAM New Construction 2018 shell and core (not fully fitted)  Post-Construction Review for phase 2 certificate and summary score sheet shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.
Condition : 13 - Submission of Renewable Energy Scheme
The turbines shall not be brought into operation until the applicant has demonstrated and notified NATS and Heathrow Airport with the following information.
 	The date the turbines are expected to become operational/start rotating.
 	The position of the turbine towers in Latitude and Longitude.
 	The height of the turbines in metres above ordnance datum and above ground level.

No subsequent alterations to the approved renewable energy scheme are to take place unless submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall be implemented as approved.
Condition : 14 - Phased Contamination 

Before the development hereby permitted commences: 
	a. A scheme for removal of the risk from contamination identified on the site shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, for written approval. The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied. 

During the course of the development: 
	b. The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues. 

Before the development is first brought into use: 
	c. The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. 
Condition : 15 - Air Quality

(A)	Prior to the commencement of any construction or demolition works at the proposed site of Phase 1, a detailed air quality assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority detailing the maximum HDV movements associated with the construction phase of Phase 1 . Surrounding sensitive receptors along the expected route are to be included within the assessment. 

(B)	Prior to the commencement of any construction or demolition works at the proposed site of Phase 2, a detailed air quality assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority detailing the maximum HDV movements associated with the construction phase of Phase 2. Surrounding sensitive receptors along the expected route are to be included within the assessment. 
Condition : 16 - Air Quality - NRMM
All Non-road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) used during the course of the development that is within the scope of the GLA 'Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition' Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) dated July 2014, or any successor document, shall comply with the emissions requirements therein.
Condition : 17 - EV Charging Points
(A)	No development above ground level for Phase 1 (excluding demolition and site preparation works) shall take place until full details of the Electric Vehicle Charging Points, each capable of a minimum output of 7.2kW, are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase. The details shall include manufacturer's specifications and the number of spaces provided with active and passive capabilities shall comply with the London Plan standards.
(B)	No development above ground level for Phase 2 (excluding demolition, site preparation and basement works) shall take place until full details of the Electric Vehicle Charging Points, each capable of a minimum output of 7.2kW, are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase. The details shall include manufacturer's specifications and the number of spaces provided with active and passive capabilities shall comply with the London Plan standards.
The charging points shall be installed in accordance with the approved details, with photographic evidence submitted to the Local Planning Authority upon completion, and so maintained at all times thereafter.
Condition : 18 - Tree Planting
(a)	Phase 2  (except any demolition, site clearance, ground investigation and remediation work) shall not commence until a full specification of all proposed tree planting has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The specification shall include the quantity, size, species, and positions or density of all trees to be planted, how they will be planted and protected and the proposed times of planting. 
(b)	All trees shall be planted in accordance with the details and times stated in the approved specification and in accordance with British Standard 8545:2014 (or an equivalent British Standard if replaced).
(c)	Any trees that, within five years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced with another tree of a similar size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction.
Condition : 19 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to the first occupation of Phase 2, and following the agreement of an end-user, full details of the proposed security gates at the top of the listed steps shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 20 - The hereby approved development must be carried out  in accordance with the details and recommendations outlined within the Stage 1 Road Safety Audit, received on: 28/04/2022

Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the details of the highway works to ensure safe access, supported by a Stage 2 Road Safety Audit shall be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved details shall be implemented on site prior to the occupation of any part of the development.
Condition : 21 - Parking and deliveries management plan
(A)	Prior to the first occupation of Phase 1 hereby approved development, a car parking and deliveries management strategy for that phase must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
(B)	Prior to the first occupation of Phase 2 hereby approved development, a car parking and deliveries management strategy for that phase must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
Condition : 22 - Signage
(A)	Notwithstanding the details of the approved plans, prior to first occupation of Phase 1 of the development hereby approved, full details of any proposed signage for that phase must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

(C)(B)	Notwithstanding the details of the approved plans, prior to first occupation of Phase 2 of the development hereby approved, full details of any proposed signage for that phase must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
Condition : 23 - Pedestrian routes
Notwithstanding the details of the approved plans, prior to commencement of any Phase of the development, full details of the revised pedestrian routes on Shield Drive and Amalgamated Drive must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
Condition : 24 - Pedestrian access
Prior to the first occupation of Phase 2 of the herby approved development, full details of pedestrian access management into the site through the listed entrance must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The management plan must detail how access would be granted and the proposed safety arrangements to avoid conflicts between vehicles and pedestrian. 
Condition : 25 - Ecology
The development hereby approved must be carried out in accordance with the recommendations set out in the BREEAM Ecology Assessment, received on 13/01/2022.
